p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d10 per Warrior level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Warrior level after 1st.

Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Heavy Armour, Shields. Weapons: Simple Blasters, Martial Blasters, Simple Vibroweapons, Martial Vibroweapons. Saving Throws: Strength and Constitution.
Skills. Choose 2 from Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Intimidation, Persuasion, Perception, Survival.

sheet.description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.

description.p: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

sheet.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

description.p: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a Bonus Action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your Warrior level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: Regain 1d10 + {{level:warrior}} hit points.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional Action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

sheet.description: On your turn, you can take one additional Action.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, you can use Action Surge twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

sheet.description: On your turn, you can take one additional Action (max once per turn).

description.p: At 3rd level, you choose a subclass that defines your specialized path: Battle Master, Brute, or Jettrooper. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 6th, 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.

sheet.description: You can attack twice whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Beginning at 11th level, you can attack three times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack three times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 20th level, you can attack four times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack four times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Battle Masters are warriors who have studied the art of combat, learning maneuvers that allow them to control the battlefield.
When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

Maneuvers. You learn three maneuvers of your choice. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

Superiority Dice. You have four superiority dice, which are d8s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

Saving Throws. Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows: Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

sheet.description: You have superiority dice (d8s) that fuel your maneuvers. You learn 3 maneuvers at 3rd level, and 2 more at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Maneuver save DC = 8 + proficiency + Str or Dex modifier.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one type of tool of your choice.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency with one type of tool of your choice.

description.p: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice: Strength score, Dexterity score, Constitution score, Armour Class, Current Hit Points.

sheet.description: After 1 minute observing a creature, learn if it's equal, superior, or inferior in 2 chosen stats (Str, Dex, Con, AC, or HP).

description.p: At 10th level, your superiority dice turn into d10s. At 18th level, they turn into d12s.

sheet.description: Your superiority dice become d10s (d12s at 18th level).

description.p: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative with no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 die.

description.p: Brutes are warriors who rely on overwhelming force and durability to crush their enemies.

Starting at 3rd level, you're able to strike with your weapons with especially brutal force. Whenever you hit with a weapon that you're proficient with and deal damage, the weapon's damage increases by an amount based on your level in this class: levels 3-9: +1d4, levels 10-15: +1d6, levels 16-19: +1d8, level 20: +1d10.

sheet.description: When you hit with a proficient weapon, add bonus damage: lv 3-9: +1d4, lv 10-15: +1d6, lv 16-19: +1d8, lv 20: +1d10.

description.p: Beginning at 7th level, your toughness allows you to shrug off assaults that would devastate others. Whenever you make a saving throw, roll 1d6 and add the die to your saving throw total. If applying this bonus to a death saving throw increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the d20.

sheet.description: Whenever you make a saving throw, roll 1d6 and add it to the total. On death saves, if this brings you to 20+, it counts as a natural 20.

description.p: At 10th level, you can choose a second Fighting Style.

sheet.description: You can choose a second Fighting Style.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, when you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you gain a bonus to that weapon's damage roll equal to your level in this class.

sheet.description: When you score a critical hit, add your Warrior level to the damage.

description.p: At 18th level, you attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle. At the start of each of your turns in combat, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points or if you have more than half of your hit points left.

sheet.description: At the start of your turn, regain 5 + Con mod HP (min 1). Not at 0 HP or above half HP.

description.p: Jettroopers are warriors equipped with specialized jetpacks and modified weapons, allowing them to dominate the battlefield from the air.
At 3rd level, you gain Jump Pack proficiency.

sheet.description: You gain Jump Pack proficiency.

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain Hover Pack proficiency.

sheet.description: You gain Hover Pack proficiency.

description.p: At 7th level, you gain Jetpack proficiency.

sheet.description: You gain Jetpack proficiency.

description.p: At 10th level, you can customize your ranged weapons. Choose one weapon modification that applies to all ranged weapons you use. You can choose an additional modification at 15th level.

sheet.description: Choose one weapon modification for all ranged weapons. Choose another at 15th level.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, when lifting off or landing with your jump/hover pack, jetpack, or boots, creatures within 5 feet must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 1d6 kinetic damage and are pushed 5 feet away. On a success, they take half damage and aren't pushed.

sheet.description: When lifting off/landing with jet equipment, creatures within 5 feet DC 13 Con save or take 1d6 kinetic damage and are pushed 5 feet.

description.p: At 18th level, each weapon modification you own turns into its improved version.

sheet.description: Each weapon modification you own becomes its improved version.

description.p: When you make a ranged attack, add 1d4 to your attack roll.

sheet.description: When you make a ranged attack, add 1d4 to your attack roll.

description.p: Increase your blaster's range by 1.5× its normal value.

sheet.description: Increase your blaster's range by 1.5×.

description.p: When a ranged attack hits, roll your damage die twice with modifiers and deal 75% rounded up of the combined result.

sheet.description: Roll damage twice, deal 75% rounded up of combined result.

sheet.description: Once per turn, fire twice at the same target (two attack rolls).

description.p: When a ranged attack hits, the next attack roll made against this creature has advantage.

sheet.description: When you hit, next attack against that creature has advantage.

description.p: Ranged attacks deal area damage. When a ranged attack hits, creatures at the center take full damage, and creatures within 5 feet take half damage.

sheet.description: Target takes full damage, creatures within 5 feet take half.

description.p: When a ranged attack hits a creature, that creature's AC is reduced by 1 until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: Target's AC reduced by 1 until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Increase the ammo count 1.5× before needing to reload.

sheet.description: Ammo capacity increased by 1.5×.

description.p: When you make a ranged attack, add 1d6 to your attack roll.

sheet.description: When you make a ranged attack, add 1d6 to your attack roll.

description.p: Increase your blaster's range by 2× its normal value.

sheet.description: Increase your blaster's range by 2×.

description.p: When a ranged attack hits, roll your damage die twice with modifiers and combine the results.

sheet.description: Roll damage twice and combine the results.

description.p: Once per turn, your ranged weapon fires three times in rapid succession. Make three attack rolls against the same target.

sheet.description: Once per turn, fire three times at the same target (three attack rolls).

description.p: When a ranged attack hits, the next attack roll made against this creature has advantage. You also roll the damage die twice and take the highest result.

sheet.description: Next attack has advantage, and you roll damage twice taking the highest.
